body.p: In some cases, paragraph 63 of IAS 19 requires an entity to recognise an asset. E54 proposed that the amount of the asset recognised should not exceed the aggregate of the present values of:

li.p: any refunds expected from the plan; and
any expected reduction in future contributions arising from the surplus.

body.p: In approving E54, IASC took the view that an entity should not recognise an asset at an amount that exceeds the present value of the future benefits that are expected to flow to the entity from that asset. This view was consistent with IASC’s proposal in its exposure draft E55 Impairment of Assets that assets should not be carried at more than their recoverable amount. IAS 19 before its revision in 1998 contained no such restriction.
